title: Fall River man shot dead by police after shooting 2 officers, DA says
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Nigel Vaughn, 40, was shot dead by Fall River police after allegedly shooting two officers during an altercation.
Vaughn fired at officers, hitting one in the elbow and another in a bulletproof vest during a struggle.
Officers discovered an automatic gun near Vaughn, and the officers involved were treated for non-life-threatening injuries.

title: Man charged with motor vehicle homicide after woman, 70, killed in New Bedford crash
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Andrew Johansen, 34, was charged with motor vehicle homicide after a crash that killed a 70-year-old woman in New Bedford.
Johansen was cited for OUI, negligence, marked lane violation, and possessing an open container of alcohol in his vehicle.
Bail for Johansen was set at $5,000 with conditions including a GPS monitor, curfew, and remaining alcohol-free.

title: 2 Framingham police officers off the force after misconduct probe, department says
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Two unnamed Framingham police officers were dismissed after an internal investigation substantiated violations of departmental rules.
The officers were initially placed on paid administrative leave in September 2025 due to allegations of misconduct.
The matter has been referred to the Middlesex County DA and the Massachusetts POST Commission for further investigation.

title: Super Bowl 2026: Watch Charlie Puth perform the National Anthem
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Charlie Puth performed the National Anthem at Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, California.
The performance preceded a game between the New England Patriots and Seattle Seahawks.
Prior performances included Coco Jones with 'Lift Every Voice and Sing' and Brandi Carlile's 'America the Beautiful'.

title: Patriots’ Mack Hollins shows up in shackles, honors Mike Vrabel with separate Super Bowl outfit
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mack Hollins arrived at Super Bowl LX dressed in a prison jumpsuit with shackles, referencing 'Silence of the Lambs'.
During warmups, Hollins wore a Mike Vrabel high school jersey, celebrating Vrabel's NFL Coach of the Year award.
Mike Vrabel sported a Hawaiian lei, gifted by Khyiris Tonga's mother, as part of his pregame travel outfit.

title: The Celtics had their worst shooting night in years in loss to Jalen Brunson, Knicks: 7 takeaways
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: The Boston Celtics shot 17.1% from 3-point range, their worst performance in years, in a 111-89 loss to the Knicks.
Jalen Brunson led the Knicks with 31 points, while Celtics' addition Nikola Vučević struggled with defense, scoring 11 points.
Celtics' Jaylen Brown criticized referees for offensive foul calls, citing inconsistency in ruling elbow contact with defenders.

title: Why Mike Vrabel played U2 before Patriots’ final Super Bowl meeting
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel played U2's 'Beautiful Day' before Super Bowl LX for its symbolic significance.
Super Bowl XXXVI's upset victory by underdog Patriots, with Vrabel as part of the team, inspired the song choice.
Seattle Seahawks are 4.5-point favorites, while Vrabel emphasized 'Belief, Identity, Rage' to his players.

title: ‘You guys got it wrong’: Rodney Harrison calls out Tony Dungy over Bill Belichick Hall of Fame snub
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rodney Harrison criticized Tony Dungy for Bill Belichick's omission from the Pro Football Hall of Fame.
Dungy defended the Hall of Fame voting process but did not disclose his personal vote on Belichick.
Harrison stated Belichick was more deserving than any other candidate, highlighting his impact on players like Tom Brady.

title: Jordon Hudson takes shot at Robert Kraft with controversial T-shirt
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jordon Hudson wore an 'Orchids of Asia' shirt at a UNC-Duke game, referencing a past scandal involving Robert Kraft.
Kraft faced solicitation charges in 2019 connected to the 'Orchids of Asia' spa, but they were later dropped in 2020.
Bill Belichick and Robert Kraft missed the Pro Football Hall of Fame's Class of 2026, despite past achievements.

title: Seahawks 9, Patriots 0 (Half): Patriots offense sputtering
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots trail the Seahawks 9-0 at halftime in Super Bowl LX in Santa Clara, Calif.
New England's offense struggles, managing only 52 total yards and five punts across five drives.
Drake Maye faces heavy pressure from the Seahawks, contributing to the Patriots' offensive difficulties.
